newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malaysian Airline to buy 747-600Xs jets.
newsitem.headline: Malaysian Airline to buy 747-600Xs jets.

text.p: Malaysian Airline System Bhd (MAS) said on Thursday that it intends to be the launch customer for the new Boeing 747-600Xs super jumbo jets built by Seattle-based Boeing Co.

MAS chairman Tajudin Ramli was quoted by the national Bernama news agency as saying that the company's board of directors had agreed to the purchase of six of the aircraft in order to be the launch customer.
This would be the first time the Malaysian national carrier is a launch customer for new aircraft.
Tajudin said the airline would discuss the proposed purchase with the aircraft manufacturer soon. The price of the proposed acquisition was not reported.
Earlier this year, Malaysia Airlines announced it was acquiring 15 B777 and 10 B747 aircraft from Boeing to raise its fleet to 120 as part of a modernisation and rationalisation programme.
